etymologies: mid 17th century. From acroamatic, after post-classical Latin acroamatica or its etymon Byzantine Greek τὰ ἀκροαματικά writings on esoteric subjects, use as noun of neuter plural of ἀκροαματικός

definitions: Frequently with capital initial. (The name of) lectures given by Aristotle to intimate friends and scholars on the esoteric parts of his philosophy.
